page.title: 10YOXALL_EDUCATION
page.content: A playgoup provides a meeting place for pre-school age children. Between the ages of five and eleven years children attend the village Primary School. After this age they are transported by bus to the Comprehensive School in Barton-under-Needwood where all are educated to the age of sixteen but may stay a further two years. Adult education classes for ballroom dancing and keep fit are held in the village while some people travel to Barton-under-Needwood for classes in other subjects. A Parent Teacher Association at St.Peter's Primary School keeps a watchful eye on all aspects of school life. A travelling library service is available. There is an evening class run by Keele University on the history of Yoxall.
